Key Arguments: The bill is an attack on freedom of speech.
The terms 'misinformation' and 'disinformation' are unnecessary and represent political language that obscures truth.
The bill represents a move towards totalitarianism, not democracy.
The government's handling of COVID-19 is cited as evidence of a totalitarian approach.
The bill would strip people of their power to speak freely and believe what they want.
The media's failure to deliver honest information contributes to ignorance, not the people's discussions.
Notable Quotes: In a world where our lives are to a great extent connected online, this bill is an attack on freedom of speech.
